element.headline: Aspiring Cybersecurity & Systems Engineer | B.Tech CSE Student | C, Python, Linux & Kernel Development
element.about:
As a second-year Computer Science student, I'm driven by a deep curiosity for how systems work, from the web applications we use every day down to the operating system kernel that powers them. My journey began in cybersecurity, where I became proficient with the Kali Linux environment, not just as a user of tools, but as a student of the underlying vulnerabilities they expose.
This top-down exploration naturally led me to a fascination with the Linux kernel itself. I am now actively learning C and systems programming to understand how to build secure, low-level software. I believe that to truly defend a system, one must understand its core architecture.
Alongside my systems-level interests, I have practical experience in full-stack web development, building applications with Python and JavaScript. This dual perspective allows me to understand both how to build modern software and how to secure it from the ground up.
I am actively seeking internship opportunities where I can apply my skills in cybersecurity, systems programming, or a role that combines both. I am a quick learner, a natural leader, and eager to contribute to a team that is solving challenging problems.

projects.title: Job Portal Smart Contrat
projects.description:
Decentralized Job Portal Smart Contract

This project implements a decentralized job portal using Ethereum blockchain technology. The smart contract, written in Solidity, provides a secure and transparent platform for managing job listings, applicant profiles, and the application process.

Key Features:
1. Admin-controlled job and applicant management
2. Applicant profile creation and retrieval
3. Job listing creation and searching
4. Job application functionality
5. Applicant rating system

The contract allows an administrator to add job applicants and create job listings. Job seekers can view their profiles, search for jobs based on roles, and apply for positions that match their skills and expectations. Employers can post job openings with detailed descriptions, including company name, job role, required experience, salary, work location type, and the number of openings.

One of the unique aspects of this smart contract is its applicant rating feature, which allows for the addition of performance or interview ratings for each applicant. This adds a layer of qualitative assessment to the hiring process while maintaining transparency.

The contract also includes functions to retrieve applied jobs for each applicant and to get applicant details, making it easier for both employers and job seekers to track applications and manage the hiring process.

This project demonstrates the potential of blockchain technology in creating transparent and efficient job marketplaces. It's an excellent starting point for anyone interested in exploring decentralized platforms for employment or implementing secure and transparent hiring mechanisms in various organizational contexts.

Technologies used:
- Solidity 0.8.24
- Ethereum blockchain

Note: This contract serves as a proof of concept. For real-world deployment, thorough security audits and optimizations are essential.

projects.title: Voting Smart Contract.
projects.description:
Decentralized Voting System Smart Contract
This project implements a decentralized voting system using Ethereum blockchain technology. The smart contract, written in Solidity, provides a secure and transparent platform for conducting elections with features designed to ensure fairness and prevent common voting issues.

Key Features:
1. Admin-controlled election management
2. Candidate and voter registration
3. Secure voting mechanism
4. Vote delegation capability
5. Real-time result tracking
6. Automatic winner determination
The contract allows an administrator to add candidates and register voters before the election begins. Once the election is started, registered voters can cast their votes for their preferred candidates or delegate their voting rights to other voters. The system prevents double voting and ensures that only registered voters can participate.

One of the unique aspects of this smart contract is its vote delegation feature, which allows voters to transfer their voting rights to other participants if they trust their judgment or are unable to vote themselves. This adds a layer of flexibility to the voting process while maintaining the integrity of the election.

After the election concludes, the contract provides functions to view the results, including vote counts for each candidate and an automatic determination of the winner based on the highest number of votes received.

This project demonstrates the potential of blockchain technology in creating transparent, tamper-resistant voting systems. It's an excellent starting point for anyone interested in exploring decentralized governance models or implementing secure voting mechanisms in various organizational contexts.

Technologies used:
- Solidity 0.8.24
- Ethereum blockchain

Note: This contract serves as a proof of concept. For real-world deployment, thorough security audits and optimizations are essential.

With 8+ years of experience developing dynamic and user-centric applications, I specialize in JavaScript, React, and modern web technologies to build high-performance, scalable solutions.

At Six Sigma Sports, I lead the development of blockchain and cryptocurrency platforms, focusing on user engagement, real-time data processing, and performance optimization. My expertise spans:

Web3 & Authentication – Web3Auth, OAuth2, DeFi wallet integrations
Frontend Performance – Optimizing load times & enhancing UI/UX
Full-Stack Development – React, Next.js, Node.js, Remix, Express.js

experience.description:
Building Scalable Web3 & Blockchain-Based Platforms

At ST Labs, I lead the development of blockchain and cryptocurrency-based platforms, optimizing user engagement, real-time data processing, and application performance.

Key Responsibilities:
Frontend Development: Built and optimized high-performance applications using React, Next.js, and Remix.
Web3 & Blockchain Integrations: Implemented Web3Auth, OAuth2, Keplr, and DeFi wallet integrations for seamless authentication and secure transactions.
Real-Time Data & Performance Optimization: Developed frameworks for real-time data streaming and load-time reduction.
Collaborative Development: Worked with cross-functional teams, including blockchain engineers, backend developers, and product teams, to deliver robust solutions.
Mentorship & Leadership: Guided junior developers and promoted best coding practices within the team.

Impact & Achievements:
Optimized Performance: Reduced frontend load times by 30% through caching and optimized rendering techniques.
Enhanced Security: Integrated secure authentication protocols (OAuth2, Web3Auth) to improve user trust and platform security.
Blockchain Scalability: Implemented CosmJS & Cosmos Ecosystem tools to enhance decentralized app functionality.
User Growth & Engagement: Contributed to scalable and user-friendly interfaces, increasing adoption rates.

Key Technologies Used:
React, Next.js, Remix, Node.js, Web3Auth, CosmJS, Keplr, OAuth2, Redux, Tailwind CSS, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Express.js

Key Contributions Across Multiple High-Impact Projects

Hotels Platform
  Core Developer for a user-friendly hotel booking interface using React.
  Optimized search, comparison, and reservation processes, improving booking efficiency and user experience.

Seller Panel
  Enhanced the seller panel interface, improving functionality and usability for sellers managing products and transactions.
  Contributed to UI/UX enhancements, ensuring a seamless onboarding experience for new sellers.

Open Network for Digital Commerce (ONDC)

  Helped develop interoperability frameworks, ensuring smooth transactions across diverse platforms.

Hi5 Project (Social Commerce Initiative)

  Designed and implemented a seamless UI/UX and a scalable backend system for managing group transactions.

Key Technologies Used:
React, Next.js, Node.js, Redux, Webpack, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, OAuth2, Web3Auth

Building Scalable & Engaging Virtual Trading Experiences

At Trakinvest, I played a key role in enhancing the virtual trading experience, developing new Next.js-powered applications, and implementing dynamic modules for certificates, event pages, and landing pages.

Key Contributions & Projects:
Virtual Trading System 
Maintained & enhanced the virtual trading platform, ensuring a seamless, risk-free trading experience for learners.
Improved frontend performance & UI/UX, increasing user engagement and retention.

Landing Page Development

  Effectively showcased the company's offerings, driving user acquisition & engagement.

Next.js External Product 
  Developed an external product using Next.js, demonstrating proficiency in server-side rendering (SSR), static generation (SSG), and API integrations.
  Expanded the company’s product portfolio, enhancing market reach.

Certificate Generation Module 
   Built a dynamic certificate issuance system, allowing users to receive automated, personalized completion certificates upon finishing courses.
  Improved operational efficiency by 200%, reducing manual work.

Event Webpages Module
  Designed a flexible, reusable module for generating custom event webpages with unique layouts.
  Enabled efficient event promotion & management, streamlining company outreach.

Key Technologies Used:
Next.js, React, Redux, Node.js, Tailwind CSS, Bootstrap, Webpack, Express.js, Gatsby.js,

Full-Stack Development with React, Python, and PostgreSQL

At Goodearth, I developed frontend-heavy applications while also handling backend development using Python and PostgreSQL, ensuring a seamless and engaging user experience.

Key Contributions & Projects:
Full-Stack React & Python Development 
  Built scalable applications using React and Python, demonstrating expertise in frontend and backend 
  integration.
  Designed and optimized PostgreSQL databases to ensure efficient data handling and performance.

Frontend-Heavy UI/UX Pages 
   Created multiple visually appealing, responsive, and user-friendly pages with a strong emphasis on UI/UX.
  Ensured accessibility and seamless cross-device compatibility.

Database Creation & Optimization 
  Designed and implemented efficient PostgreSQL databases, improving data retrieval speed and scalability.
  Optimized queries and indexing to enhance performance and reliability.

Social Authentication Integration 
   Implemented OAuth-based authentication, enabling users to sign up and log in via Google, Facebook, and other social media platforms.
   Enhanced security and user convenience by streamlining the authentication process.

Interactive Book Feature with Turn.js 
   Integrated the Turn.js library to create an interactive book-like UI, improving content presentation and user engagement.
   Delivered an innovative and engaging reading experience.

Address Module & Maps System 
  Developed a location-based address module with integrated maps for real-time geographic data.
  Enabled users to access accurate location details, improving navigation and user experience.

Key Technologies Used:
React, Python, PostgreSQL, Redux, OAuth2, Turn.js, Google Maps API, Tailwind CSS, Express.js

Developing Scalable Employee-Centric Platforms for Improved Collaboration & Productivity

At Globallogic, I built and enhanced employee-focused platforms, enabling seamless collaboration, efficient resource management, and streamlined internal communication.

Key Contributions & Projects: 
Employee Consortium Portal

Internal Employee Directory

Content Management System (CMS)

  Ensured seamless access to company resources, contributing to an efficient and well-organized workplace.

element.about:

A keen enthusiast towards the solutions of problems, innovations, idea sharing and motivated to learn, grow, and excel.

My passion for programming and problem-solving has driven me to constantly improve my skills and stay updated with the latest industry trends. And My ability to effectively collaborate with cross-functional teams and strong communication skills have enabled me to deliver successful projects within tight deadlines. I am always eager to take on new challenges and thrive in fast-paced environments.

In addition to my technical skills, I possess a strong work ethic and a keen attention to detail. I am driven by a desire to continuously learn and grow, and I am constantly seeking ways to enhance my knowledge and skills.

experience.description:
I am part of a dynamic team focused on delivering secure, scalable, and innovative solutions across diverse technologies.

My role involves:
Developing Applications: Building scalable, secure, and high-quality web and mobile applications using a versatile tech stack including Go, Gin, Python, Django, ReactJS, Next.js, Flutter, Docker, and AWS. Focused on creating strong backend systems, seamless user experiences, and high-performance architectures with Kafka to support demanding workloads.
Blockchain & AI Integration: Developing decentralized applications and smart contracts using Rust, Go, and Solidity, and applying AI/ML tools for GPU benchmarking to validate and optimize hardware performance within blockchain ecosystems, ensuring accuracy and trust.
Client Collaboration: Working closely with clients to understand requirements and deliver solutions aligned with business objectives.
Code Quality & Collaboration: Participating in code reviews to maintain clean, maintainable code, and collaborating with cross-functional teams for smooth, reliable delivery.
Continuous Learning: Staying current with emerging technologies to drive innovation and enhance product quality.

In this role, the focus is on turning complex challenges into practical, secure, and future-ready solutions that create real value.

• Developed and enhanced client applications by building new features and resolving existing bugs using Java technologies like Spring Boot and Hibernate JPA, and frontend technologies like ReactJS.
• Designed and implemented solutions for complex issues involving REST API architecture and intricate subqueries within the database, leveraging ORM tools for efficiency and performance.
• Optimized application performance by identifying bottlenecks and implementing best practices in code optimization and database querying, resulting in a significant improvement in response times and resource utilization.
• Freelance Java Programming and Data Structures Tutor: Successfully trained students from core Java fundamentals to advanced data structures within the Collection framework, ensuring a thorough understanding and practical application of concepts.

• Rendered technical expertise in Software development life-cycle, object oriented programming andobject oriented designing principles to develop applications based on specific client requirement.
• Documented software functionality and maintained codebase, ensuring that the system was up-to-dateand easily maintainable.
• Hands on all the phases of development i.e. design, coding & implementation of web application usingJavaEE technologies including JSP, Servlets and Spring.
• Collaborated with a team of developers to troubleshoot and debug an existing system, resolvingtechnical issues and improving system efficiency by 15%.
• Contributed to the development of a Java application, writing efficient and well-designed code thatimproved system performance by 20%.
• Performed the task with minimal direction or supervision.
• Other than this worked as a Mentor in QSpiders & JSpiders (comes under Test Yantra) on core java andprogramming with java.

element.headline: Software Engineer | Blockchain & Web3 Developer | Data & DevRel Specialist
element.about:
Software Engineer with over four years of experience in Web3, specializing in blockchain integrations, data analytics, and developer experience.

Previously a Software Engineer at Collab.Land, where I built blockchain integrations, scalable on-chain/off-chain data pipelines, and automated workflows—driving adoption across 59,000+ communities and 3.6+ million users.

Focused on improving developer experience, data-driven decision-making, and AI-driven automation. Experienced in blockchain ecosystems, analytics, and DevRel.

Looking to collaborate on impactful Web3, AI, and data-driven projects.
element.topSkills: Developer Relations • Data Analytics • Software Development • Technical Support • Product Development

experience.description:
- Providing on-chain data analysis for Web3 communities, including Crypto Nomads Club, delivering insights and weekly newsletters to 500+ members.
- Developing xpln.fun, an AI-powered web app that generates dynamic illustrations to explain complex topics at adjustable difficulty levels.

- Led blockchain integrations across Solana, Bitcoin Ordinals, Stamps, and EVM chains, expanding access for 1,500+ communities and 500,000+ users.
- Built event-driven on-chain and off-chain data pipelines, reducing query times by 70% and enabling data-driven decision-making.
- Redesigned admin onboarding, reducing drop-offs by 60% and increasing adoption across 59,000+ Web3 communities.
- Launched and scaled Developer Relations, creating API/SDK documentation, tutorials, and a Developer Portal, expanding the mini-app marketplace.
- Automated support workflows with AI, improving response times by 45% and reducing support tickets by 20% quarterly.
- Represented Collab.Land at 10+ global Web3 hackathons and conferences, securing strategic partnerships and driving ecosystem growth.

- Helped 30,000+ NFT, DAO, and DeFi communities onboard across various EVM and non-EVM networks as a Support Engineer.
- Built the Collab.Land Help documentation website and internal tools for the support team, improving efficiency and self-service.
- Developed security features to protect Web3 communities from scams and fraud.
- Contributed to product development and UX improvements based on user feedback and QA testing.
- Developed a Web3 user onboarding flow for NEAR and Aurora EVM, integrating Web3Auth and OpenZeppelin Defender to enhance UX, authentication security, and automation.
- Developed the frontend for a Web3 P2P token exchange, implementing real-time asset pricing and a responsive UI across web and mobile.
- Scaled an early-stage college growth program, leading a team of four and securing partnerships with Tier-1 institutes, including IIT Bombay.

- Closed 5 leads with test prep coaching centers for foreign university admissions, managing the entire sales pipeline from lead generation to conversion for the B2B vertical UniversityAdmissionsNetwork.

element.about:
🚀 Tech Innovator & Developer Extraordinaire

Welcome to my profile! I'm Aman, a seasoned developer dedicated to transforming visionary ideas into impactful technological solutions. With a keen eye for detail and a passion for excellence, I navigate the digital landscape with precision and purpose.

🔗 Pioneering the Blockchain Frontier
In the ever-evolving world of blockchain technology, I've honed my skills in Ethers, Hardhat, Moralis, and Brownie. My journey includes creating innovative smart contracts and decentralized applications on the Ethereum blockchain. Notable projects under my belt include full-stack NFT marketplaces, De-Fi platforms, Distributed Live-Casting platforms, and Collaborative Content Creation platforms. These achievements have solidified my reputation as a forward-thinking developer.

💻 Mastering Full-Stack Web Development
With over 3 years of comprehensive experience in full-stack web development, I bring dynamic and responsive web applications to life. Utilizing tools such as Next.js, React.js, Node.js, Django, and Flask, I craft projects that not only engage and inspire audiences but also deliver tangible results.

🧠 Embracing Technological Advancements
In a rapidly changing tech landscape, I strive to stay ahead of the curve. Beyond my expertise in blockchain and web development, I am deeply interested in exploring emerging technologies like Artificial Intelligence, Machine Learning, and the Metaverse. I leverage their potential to drive transformative change and innovation.

element.about:
I’m Rakesh Kumawat, a full-stack and blockchain developer.

Beyond coding, I love connecting with the community. I’ve had the privilege of judging prestigious hackathons, hosting blockchain workshops, and speaking at some of the biggest colleges and tech communities. Sharing knowledge and sparking curiosity in others is something I truly enjoy - whether it’s through a talk, a meetup, or just a casual chat.

For me, technology isn’t just a job ~ it’s a way to revolutionize the world. I’m always excited to collaborate with like-minded people who share that vision. If you’re looking for a dedicated developer who brings both skill and enthusiasm to the table - whether it’s for a project, a team, or a conversation - let’s connect!

Necklace Paradise is a modern, feature-rich e-commerce platform designed to provide a seamless shopping experience for jewelry lovers. Built using the MERN stack, it combines aesthetic appeal with cutting-edge functionality to deliver a robust and scalable solution.

• User Features: Secure authentication (JWT), responsive design, and dynamic cart functionality.
• Admin Dashboard: Efficient product, category, and order management capabilities.
• Seamless Checkout: Integrated Stripe payment gateway for secure and hassle-free transactions.

• Deployment: Live app hosted on Vercel (Frontend) and Render (Backend).

projects.description: Hello  Guys I just developed my first Blockchain based DApp I used Ethereum block chain for developing web app , Web3 js for connecting front end to blockchain , react For frontend development solidity for writing smart contract ,  qr code reader and qr code  module of react for generating qr code of the SHA256 hash, SHA256 function for generating product hash, meta mask for connecting local blockchain to web app truffle for testing and deploying smart contract , chai for testing smart contract  Secure scan This app work on blockchain  now day everything is going online and most of the people  love to do shopping from their  home and from their comfort  but there  is a problem how can we  insure that the product that we order is real . This App help us to  be sure that the product that I am getting is real  how does it work and how does it would help us to make sure that product is real first we generates a QR code with the help of product  details such as name, company name , and many more to make demo simple i just use a random text product and serial number we can use full details for generating qr code , this qr code would be  image of   SHA256 hash function that generate a hash with the help of product details   and store on the block chain as true  means if you ever learnt  about hash map  in data structure then its just like that every product hash would be the key and the value assosiate with that key would  be the result for that key in the starting when ever a we  create a new  product in company we make it bye  default true  that means this product is verified bye company and its a real product  and also generate the qr code for scaning and put it on to the product  once this product reached to it's  destination then the customer will scan the product with his mobile then  this app show that the product is real  and after scan  it will make the value of that key == false on blockchain so no  one can make qr code copy and  use it again for other product

element.headline: Staff Software Engineer | Okto | CoinDCX | Web3
element.about:
As a Senior Engineer at CoinDCX, I am currently part of the Okto App Engineering team, where we are at the forefront of blockchain innovation. I have been integral to the development of the Okto App and Okto SDK, powering Web3 in the CoinDCX App, from their inception. With over 10 years of experience in software development and more than 6 years dedicated to blockchain and related technologies, I am passionate about creating impactful solutions in this rapidly evolving space.

My technical expertise spans multiple blockchain platforms, including Ethereum, Solana, Aptos, Hyperledger Fabric and Corda. I have professional knowledge in Go, NodeJS (with Typescript and JavaScript), and deep experience in System Design and Microservices architecture. My work often involves integrating complex systems, utilizing various forms of intersystem communication such as HTTP, RPC, Kafka Messaging, and SQS.

I also have hands-on experience with databases like PostgresDB, MongoDB, and Redis. My focus on creating scalable, secure, and user-centric applications drives my work at CoinDCX, where I continually seek to push the boundaries of blockchain technology.

Beyond my professional responsibilities, I am an active and reputed member of the Ethereum Stack Exchange community, where I contribute regularly. I am also passionate about mentoring the next generation of engineers and frequently engage with students and professionals through talks and community involvement.

Having started my journey with a Bachelor’s degree in Electronics and Communication from TKM College of Engineering in 2014, I’ve had the privilege of working with leading organizations like Oracle, Persistent Systems, and KPMG, which have shaped my diverse skill set and industry perspective.

experience.description: Worked as a Full Stack and Devops Engineer.  Developed applications based on Blockchain. Also developed applications for the ESG domain with focus on climate accounting.
Worked as a member of the CTO team, focused on researching and developing proof of concepts and pilot applications using blockchain technology. Primary domain of research was decentralized identity.

Primarily worked on building end to end solutions using Oracle products. Focused on integration between different products. Worked on solutions showcasing the Oracle Autonomous Blockchain Cloud Service.

element.headline: All things Blockchain, Web3, Tax, Payments and Crypto | Software Engineer | Java | Python | Scala | AWS | Databricks Certified Developer for Spark | Manipal
element.about:
With 5 years of experience across IT, Travel, and Finance (Crypto) sectors, I've been instrumental in owning and driving critical projects from inception to delivery. My expertise spans a broad tech stack, including Spring, Java, Python, Scala, Angular, AWS, Docker, Apache Spark, and Apache Kafka and various technologies and methodologies required in software development cycle.

**At Gemini Crypto Exchange**
▶︎ Core and founding member of the Payments Engineering Team in India.

▶︎ Led global bank integrations with a new Scala-based backend (had no prior experience in Scala before this).

▶︎ Have decreased the time for bank integration required for making fiat payments from almost more than a year to within 3 months.

▶︎ Spearheaded the transition from a monolith to microservices, accelerating release cycles from weekly to daily.

▶︎ Owing complete Release Cycle for Payments at Gemini.

▶︎ Mentored new joiners and interns (from 0 years of experience to 7+), ensuring seamless on boarding and helping them deliver from the get-go.

**At United Airlines (Contract)**
▶︎ Have saved more than 180 human-hours/month by automating the process for monitoring issues in production environments for United Airlines.

▶︎ Twice awarded "Star of the Month" for mastering PySpark, Spark, and Palantir Foundry, contributing significantly to the client’s success.

**At Amadeus**
▶︎ Holding anchor when the team was highly unstable (due to heavy attrition during Covid) and the committed timelines were tight!

▶︎ Had brought down the software development cycle of creating a Report in Amadeus CRS from 12 human days to 2 human days by introducing dynamic features in the product.

▶︎ Has achieved High-Flyer Award in the Q1 of 2021 for taking complete ownership of crucial epics and delivering within committed timelines.

**Cross-Industry Strengths**
▶︎ Working in Production Environment directly providing instant RCA and fixes to the customer and problems.

▶︎ Have worked in an Agile Scrum development team delivering with above 95% velocity consistently in every sprint.

▶︎ I like to approach and conclude any problem with an intent to solve it (because if it were not solvable, it won't be a problem in the first place).

**Bonus point**
▶︎ I have a knack for good documentations! :D

Part of the founding engineering team (Payments) at Gemini India.

*Overview*

▶︎ Built a Report Ingestion System: 
Developed a fully automated system using Scala, AWS SQS, and AWS SNS to fetch and process bank reports, reducing manual effort by 3 hours daily and streamlining data ingestion from multiple banks.

▶︎ DBS Bank Integration: 
Owned and delivered the full deposit integration for DBS Bank (Singapore), ensuring secure and fraud-tolerant FAST payments, while aligning with bank systems.

▶︎ Designed a Transfer Dispute System: 
Build for WorldPay and PayPal, reducing resolution time by 35% and improving customer experience, resulting in a significant increase in repeat transactions

▶︎ Coordinated Critical LHV Bank Integration: 
Led the urgent update of API formats for LHV Bank (Estonia) before a critical deadline during the holiday season. This effort ensured uninterrupted payments of €2.5–3 million monthly and solidified trust in the Gemini India office's capability.

▶︎ Event-Based System Development: 
Designed an event-driven system using AWS SNS and Apache Kafka to decouple notifications and side effects from the monolith, improving system scalability and reducing complexity.

▶︎ Mentorship: 
Guided 5 final-year B.Tech interns on projects ranging from building real-time deposit processors to containerizing local environments for improved developer efficiency, and breaking up monolith services into microservices.

▶︎ On-Call Firefighting: 
Working at the warfront with whatever equipment we got and saved the customers from burning in the fire of what we call Bugs. :)

*Key Achievements*

▶︎ Delivered high-impact projects that established the credibility of the Gemini India office, leading to more complex and critical work being assigned.

▶︎ Mastered Scala in just one week, contributing from day one.

▶︎ Received a rating of 4/5, reflecting consistent performance that exceeded expectations.

For more information, visit https://www.gemini.com/

*Overview*

▶︎ Working for United Airlines (USA), handling and supporting the Palantir Foundry Platform used by the organization to make sense of their complete data.

▶︎ Gained working knowledge of Python/PySpark and Apache Spark architecture to handle the pipelines running on Spark in Palantir Foundry.

▶︎ Working directly in the Production Environment taking the complete ownership of Change Requests and Enhancements.

▶︎ Optimizing the workflow to use less compute resources while processing Petabytes of data coming in every day. This is done by going through the PySpark code and optimizing it.

▶︎ Consistently fixing PROD issues in SLA time to not affect the business or complex downstream pipelines.

▶︎ Contributing in the Production Support for more than 200+ Spark pipelines running in production daily.

▶︎ Ad-Hoc Analysis of data quality issues.

*Key Achievements*

▶︎ Saved more than 180 human hours/month by creating a utility using Rest APIs, Python and Foundry Recipes to automate the process for monitoring issues in production environments for United Airlines (earlier executed manually - 24/7)

▶︎ Saved 3 hours of manual efforts everyday by automating the process of identifying issues caused due to Throttling (Rate Exceeded) at AWS side (earlier it was done by scavenging through the issues manually).

▶︎ Helped in more pro-active identification of an anomaly by creating an utility with Rest APIs and Python to keep track of Apache Spark builds running in the platform on a daily basis as well as segregating them to have a better understanding of the load, the platform is experiencing at a given hour.

*Overview*

▶︎ Assigned on the United Airlines - Foundry Support Project.

▶︎ Ramped up on Python, Spark (PySpark) within one month.

▶︎ Working to improve the documentation, code quality and synergy among the team.

*Key Achievements*

▶︎ Awarded "Star of the Month" - July 2022, Jan 2023 for consistent and over the top performance towards the client.

*Overview*

▶︎ Worked on the Reporting component of CRS (Customer Reservation System) for Hoteliers to implement and deliver different Reports as per their requirements.

▶︎ Worked on Spring, Angular, Postman, Docker, Jenkins, Git to deliver with Continuous Integration (CI) and Continuous Deployment (CD)

▶︎ Improved the existing framework to make it more robust for future modifications and started documenting stuff which made ramping up new joiners faster.

▶︎ Owner of the complete CI/CD pipeline of the product and gave extended support for On-Calls.

*Key Achievements*

▶︎ Awarded "High Flyer Award for the Q4 2020" for taking complete and over the top responsibility for the component when the team had became highly unstable (heavy attrition).

▶︎ Brought down the software development cycle of creating a Report in Amadeus CRS from 12 human days to 2 human days by introducing dynamic features in the product.

▶︎ Single highhandedly delivered a complex Epic which was required to close down a new client (MGM). This was required as due to Covid, the existing client has put a pause and the team was almost completely dissolved.

*Overview*

▶︎ Worked on the Reporting Front-End component of CRS (Customer Reservation System) provided by Amadeus to Hoteliers which is a webapp with front-end based on Angular and back-end based on Java (Spring Boot) and Oracle Database.

▶︎ Worked completely alone on Flexi-Reports to provide the ability to the hotelier to generate Reports dynamically (they can choose what fields they want to see in a report and what Inputs they want to give in to generate a Report) instead of the current fixed number of Reports provided by Amadeus.

element.headline: Full-Stack Developer | React, Node.js, Next.js | Blockchain & Web3 Engineer | DeFi, Real-Time Systems, Scalable Architecture
element.about:
As a Full-Stack Developer with years of hands-on experience, I specialize in building high-performance web, mobile, desktop, and blockchain applications. I'm skilled in React, Next.js, Node.js, NestJS, and Spring Boot, with a strong focus on clean architecture, scalability, and seamless user experiences.

I've led the development of crypto exchange platforms, DeFi applications, and real-time systems—delivering solutions that serve thousands of users with 99.9% uptime and optimized database performance. I'm also passionate about Web3 technologies and enjoy working on projects that bridge blockchain functionality with intuitive front-end interfaces.

Whether working solo or collaborating with cross-functional teams, I thrive on solving real-world problems through well-crafted code, thoughtful design, and continuous learning. I'm always open to exciting opportunities, innovative ideas, and meaningful connections.

element.headline: Rust Engineer · Web3 Security Researcher
element.about:
Engineer focused on Blockchain, Security Audits, and Low-Latency Systems.

I’m currently working on high-performance trading infrastructure at NautilusTrader, where I build latency-critical systems in Rust. Previously, I contributed to a custom storage engine at Ark-Builders, where I designed a Java-integrated file system with custom LRU caching and high-concurrency support.

I’ve also contributed to cloud infrastructure tools through the LFX program at the Linux Foundation, and audited production-grade blockchain protocols across Substrate, Cosmos, EVM, and Cardano — identifying critical vulnerabilities before deployment.

In addition to full-time roles, I take on select freelance projects. Highlights include:
- Designing swap algorithms for Leapwallet (TON) to optimize DeFi execution with custom routing logic.
- Building a secure PostgreSQL proxy server with model-based query transformation and S3-backed storage.

I focus on writing robust, production-grade software that performs under pressure and scales with real-world usage.
element.topSkills: Blockchain • Rust (Programming Language) • Security Audits • Go (Programming Language)

profileTopEducation.schoolName: Birla Institute of Technology and Science, Pilani

experience.description:
Rewrote core trading components (Throttler, Risk Engine, Portfolio) from Cython to Rust for integration with a new high-speed message bus.
- Ported Redis integration from Cython to Rust, achieving a 3× performance improvement in cache operations.
- Converted multiple financial indicators to Rust to boost the speed and accuracy of trading signal generation.
- Built and launched nautilustrader.io using Next.js to improve visibility and developer engagement.
- Created nautilustrader.io/docs using Docusaurus to deliver a comprehensive, developer-friendly documentation experience.

Jaegertracing is an open-source, distributed tracing system developed by Uber Technologies and donated to the Cloud Native Computing Foundation (CNCF). It is designed to help developers and operators understand the behavior and performance of complex, microservices-based systems.

During the mentorship, 
- We Developed multiple custom OpenTelemetry Extensions to configure various Jaeger components on top of the OpenTelemetry Collector.
- We Implemented End-to-End Integration tests to ensure the proper functionality of all OpenTelemetry components.
- We Engineered a Remote Sampling Extension supporting Adaptive and file provider capabilities to Process and Filter traces effectively.

projects.title: Leapwallet – TON DeFi Swap Algorithm [Freelance]
projects.description:
Designed and implemented optimized token swap algorithms for moki.ag, a TON-based DEX aggregator.
- Achieved up to ~1% better trade output by evaluating and deploying custom multi-path routing logic.
- Tailored solutions specifically for TON's liquidity structure and user behavior.
- Integrated and benchmarked multiple routing strategies across available pools.

> Commercial client project — source code is not publicly available.

projects.title: ARK Builders [Freelance]
projects.description:
Designed and developed a high-performance file and folder storage system in Rust.
- Built a custom LRU cache to reduce access latency for frequently used data.
- Integrated with Java/Kotlin applications using JNI bindings for seamless cross-language performance.
- Outperformed standard OS-level storage (e.g. Windows) in key file operations.
- Created a CLI interface and implemented robust property-based testing to ensure system reliability under high concurrency.

> Ongoing development — production-focused system; open source.

projects.title: PostgreSQL Proxy Server with Model-Based Querying [Freelance]
projects.description:
Developed a high-performance Rust proxy for PostgreSQL that enables semantic querying using JSON-defined models.
- Translated abstract model queries into executable SQL at runtime with adaptive transformation logic.
- Enforced strict privilege separation to isolate access based on user roles.
- Integrated S3 for model storage and hot-reload capability without downtime.

> Built for production infrastructure — closed-source due to commercial use.

element.about:
Hello! I am a final-year Information Technology student at Cochin University of Science and Technology with a passion for software development. My focus is on developing software applications that are intuitive, user-friendly, and efficient.

Currently, I am learning blockchain technology to expand my skill set. I have experience in web development and Flutter development, which is both valuable tools for creating responsive and scalable applications.

As an aspiring software developer, I am always eager to take on new challenges and collaborate with others to develop innovative solutions. If you are interested in learning more about my work, please feel free to connect with me.

profileTopEducation.schoolName: Cochin University of Science and Technology

experience.description:
Driving innovation and efficiency in software development, I enhance tech development and product offerings at KIREAP Technologies with a focus on blockchain systems and payment integration.

Key Achievements:
• Spearheading the transition from public blockchain networks (Polygon) to a private Hyperledger Fabric network, aiming to increase transaction throughput capability by 50% and cut transaction confirmation time by 60%.
• Ensuring 100% data privacy and integrity while scaling to manage 2X the current transaction volume.
• Boosting payment system performance with FastAPI, accelerating processing speed.
• Revolutionizing payment microservices by migrating from monolithic to microservices-based architecture, enhancing scalability and reducing deployment times.
• Securing payment processing with  industry compliance and improving data privacy.
• Strengthening security measures by 50% through advanced authorization and authentication systems.

My Role Involves:
• Advancing blockchain systems with ongoing private network transitions and smart contract development.
• Designing and optimizing high-performance backend systems using FastAPI.
• Structuring and managing databases with PostgreSQL.
• Implementing DevOps strategies to streamline development and deployment.
• Scaling and enhancing payment integration through microservices.
• Collaborating with teams to translate business needs into scalable solutions.
• Continuously elevating code quality and system performance.

publications.title: Retinal Disease Classification from Retinal-OCT Images Using Deep Learning Methods
publications.description:
Retinal diseases are the damage caused to any part of the retina. OCT images are used to
diagnose retina related diseases. Cross sectional view of the retina is obtained through Optical
Coherence Tomography (OCT). Medical disease prediction through images is time consuming
and manual process. Computer vision technology and its progress have given a solution for the
prediction and classification of  medical diseases through images. The major aim of this re-
search is to present a new deep learning-based classification model for automatically classify-
ing and predicting different retinal disorders using OCT data. In this paper, retinal disease
classification is performed using Convolution Neural Networks(CNN). CNV, DME,
DRUSEN, NORMAL images are the four classifications investigated in this study. Proposed
Retina CNN architecture is compared with existing architecture for the detection of retinal
disease. The best accuracy and better model prediction are obtained for the Retina CNN archi-
tecture with Adam optimizer with the training accuracy is 99.29% and 97.55% validation ac-
curacy.
